column98: Experienced UX/UI Manager to support the Green Energy Transition
column99:
Are you highly organised and proactive? Do you want to take part in driving the green energy transition in Europe towards a fully carbon-neutral, sustainable energy system? Do you enjoy working in a diverse and international team balancing many stakeholders? Then you may be just the person we are looking for.  
 We are seeking an experienced UX/UI Manager to lead our design team and drive the creation of exceptional user experiences across our digital products. This role combines strategic leadership with hands-on design expertise to shape our product vision and mentor team members. 
 Nordic RCC is a fast-developing company providing regional power system planning data and security analysis to support the national Transmission System Operators of Finland, Norway, Sweden and Denmark - to ensure the efficient operation of the Nordic Power System and high security of power supply at any time. 
 Key Responsibilities 
 Leadership & Team Management 
 
 Lead and mentor a team of UX/UI designers, providing guidance, feedback, and professional development opportunities 
 Establish clear goals, priorities, and performance metrics for the design team 
 Manage resource allocation and workload distribution across multiple projects 
 Conduct regular design reviews and team meetings to ensure quality and consistency 
 
 Design Strategy & Execution 
 
 Develop and maintain comprehensive design systems and guidelines 
 Drive user research initiatives and translate findings into actionable design solutions 
 Oversee the creation of wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity designs 
 Ensure consistency in user experience across all digital touchpoints 
 
 Cross-functional Collaboration 
 
 Partner with Product Management to align design strategy with business objectives 
 Work closely with Engineering teams to ensure successful implementation of designs 
 Present design solutions to stakeholders and defend design decisions 
 Facilitate workshops and design thinking sessions 
 
 Required Qualifications 
 
 Bachelor's degree in Design, HCI, or related field 
 5+ years of UX/UI design experience 
 2+ years of team management experience 
 Strong portfolio demonstrating end-to-end design process 
 Expert knowledge of design tools (Figma, Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite) 
 Experience with design systems and component libraries 
 
 Skills & Competencies 
 
 Strong leadership and team development abilities 
 Excellence in visual design, interaction design, and prototyping 
 Deep understanding of user-centered design principles 
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills 
 Outstanding communication and presentation abilities 
 Experience with usability testing and research methodologies 
 Information architecture: Organizing pages and information within a website or app so that it is navigable and accessible 
 Prototypes: Building simplified versions of a working feature or product to investigate problems and validate solutions 
 Research: Collecting and analyzing inputs such as behavioral data and customer feedback 
 Testing: Examining whether solutions are working as intended 
 Visual design: Understanding how elements like colors, font, images, and layout impact user experience 
 Wireframes: Designing blueprints that demonstrate how a solution works before displaying how it will look 
 
 What We Offer 
 
 Competitive salary and benefits package 
 Professional development opportunities 
 Chance to shape the future of digital products 
 Collaborative and innovative work environment 
 
 Employment conditions 
 You will join a company of competent, diverse, and enthusiastic colleagues. We are currently 23 nationalities with more than 30% women (striving to improve this balance) and all ages. 
 Your daily workplace will be in our newly furnished office premises in Copenhagen Towers, Ørestad. We are offering workplace flexibility to ensure a healthy work-life balance including the possibility for working from home some of your worktime.  
 Our values of fellowship, curiosity, respect, and transparency have been defined by all employees. They identify how we behave and shape the way we work together, and we expect you to see yourself in them. 
 The position is conditioned upon a satisfactory background check as well as a national security clearance, both of which will be facilitated by Nordic RCC. 
 Application deadline and contact information 
 Please apply online as soon as possible (in English) and no later than 15.03-2025. We may conduct interviews on a continuous basis. 
 To ensure a fair and unbiased recruitment process, we kindly request that you  do not include photographs  in your CVs or application materials. 
 If you have any questions, please contact Don O’Connor, Manager, Quality Management ( doc@nordic-rcc.net )
